head.title: Sept. 10-16; Fighting the Fire Next Time

hedline.hl1: Sept. 10-16; Fighting the Fire Next Time

block.p: Drawing fresh lessons, as well as big bills, from this year's wildfires, President Clinton asked Congress for $1.6 billion in new spending next year to repay firefighting costs and to ease future fire dangers. The proposal, for a 130 percent budget increase, would help pay for aggressive new efforts to thin forests near urban areas that face severe fire risks. Republicans had said that the White House's aversion to logging had contributed to this year's fires.
